result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hazel Adiene Bastien

records.addlTxt: Zoom appearances: Hazel Bastien and Atty Larimore

9:35 AM Defendant Hazel Adiene Bastien appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared by video for Hazel Adiene Bastien.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over Defendant's right to appear in person; Defendant waives that right and wishes proceed via zoom. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#4 with 1 year DJOC. Dismiss Ct#2 and Ct#3. Atty Larimore and Defendant agree.Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def .Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#4.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#4; dismisses Ct#2-3.Victim's rights are in compliance.  ADA Walker and Atty Larimore address sentencing. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the DJOC. Court approves the terms/conditions of the 1 years  DJOC. Court signs the DJOC, Clerk will email to the Defendant.
signed by Defendant and Atty Larimore
for Zoom filed by Atty Larimore

Adjustment Number: 22A 025465,
Payable Number: 69088,
Receipt Number: 22R 003468,
Amount: $20.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:33 AM Defendant Hazel Adiene Bastien not in court. Atty Joel Larimore appeared in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel request a plea/sentencing hearing. Court will allow the Defedant to appear via zoom for the plea/sentencing hearing.  10:34  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:26 PM Defendant Hazel Adiene Bastien appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  Defendant Hazel Adiene Bastien in custody.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms Defendant received copy of Complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant requests complaint read, Court reads.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Atty. Nelson enters NG pleas.  DA Hatch requests $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of NC w/IAS, ABS or residences.  Notes 72-hour no contact in effect until 12:49 AM on 01/12/22.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard conditions.  Advises Defendant does not qualify for PD.  Court questions address, phone and dob.  Non-military.  Adjourned at 3:24 PM  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
